channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2023080643
item.description:
Report X-2023080643

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: BLOOMINGTON

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon inspection it was found that the package was wet. It was discovered that one of the bottles had a hole near the handle resulting in the leakage. DescribePack: hole near handle DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed inside a bag inside a tote

X-2023080587 SequenceEvent: package was loaded to vehicle when driver noticed wet , package was given to qa for inspection . package was placed in a hazmat tote for processing DescribePack: package had a cap completely come off DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed inside a liner tote

item.title: Report E-2023080172
item.description:
Report E-2023080172

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a UN2680 Lithium Hydroxide Monohydrate release from (2) 50-pound poly bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released impacting a 1' x 1' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged bags and released product were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one case of diquat (un2927) had been damaged by a sharp object and that one of the inner poly 1 gallon bottle had released 3 ounces of product . The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023071234
item.description:
Report X-2023071234

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: ONTARIO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 20th a package came down the belt showing signs of leakage. The package contained UN1268, PETROLEUM DISTILLATES, N.O.S., 3, III. Inside the outer package was a drum inside of the liner bag. It appears that the seal on the drum is slightly cracked causing some of the liquid to leak out. The package was placed into a salvage drum, and the shipper contacted for an amended shippers declaration.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 55 pound bags of potassium hydroxide flakes (un1813) had been damaged by other freight and had released 1 pound of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023080747
item.description:
Report X-2023080747

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler noticed hazmat package was leaking and informed management. Management placed leaky package inside a tote with absorbent, and informed QA to come collect the item. DescribePack: Bottom edge of drum was dented and has a hole which caused leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a tote with absorbent to stop source of leak and absorbent was used to clean up spill on floor. Hazmat package and cleanup absorbent was then placed inside a hazmat bag, and bag was placed inside a hazmat tote and taken to be processed.

item.title: Report X-2023080536
item.description:
Report X-2023080536

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: ANAHEIM
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found to be wet on the outer container. Package was found to be a hazardous and was place in a hazmat bag and tote and taken for inspection. Upon inspection we found one of the six bottles had a loose cap causing it to leak approx. 6.oz all clean up material was kept with package. DescribePack: One of the six bottles had a loose cap causing it to leak DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package and all clean up material was kept inside bag and tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080519
item.description:
Report X-2023080519

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-29
  • City: WINDSOR
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came back to station on vehicle. Unknown at what point damage occurred after that, package was found the following day in hazmat processing area. DescribePack: Seal and cap of bottle became loose and leaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in lined hazmat tote and transferred to hazmat processing area.

item.title: Report X-2023080518
item.description:
Report X-2023080518

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler noticed hazmat package was leaking, and informed manager. Manager placed package inside a hazmat bag with absorbent. Management then used absorbent to clean up spill. QA was then called to come collect the damaged hazmat, and they placed the hazmat bag, with the damaged hazmat package and the cleanup absorbent into a hazmat tote. DescribePack: The top cap of the bottle came loose and won't seal so hazmat liquid leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a hazmat bag with absorbent to stop source of leak, and absorbent was used to clean up spill on the floor and placed inside the hazmat bag as well. Hazmat bag was also placed inside a hazmat tote and taken to be processed.

item.title: Report X-2023080511
item.description:
Report X-2023080511

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon arrival there was a good amount of spillage around the hazmat pail. Absorbent was placed to clean up the areas of spillage and was then placed in a red hazardous bin. The bin was layered with 2 sheets of absorbent, a clear hazardous materials bag, and another 2 layers of absorbent. DescribePack: The pail had a bent on the lid which was where the liquid was being released from. It was bent enough to where if it were to be leaned on its side it would completely leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent was used to clean up the spill around the pail. A red hazardous bin layered with 2 sheets of absorbent, a clear hazardous materials bag, and another 2 layers of absorbent was used to pick up the pail.

item.title: Report X-2023080501
item.description:
Report X-2023080501

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: VENTURA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG DISCOVERED ON TAIL END OF TRAILER. PKG DAMAGED AND LEAKING. NO BRACING AROUND PKG. IMPROPERLY LOADED. MANAGER CALLED OUT LEAKING PKG. UPON ARRIVAL, INSPECTION FOUND LIQUID ON SURFACE OF TRAILER. CARTON WET DAMAGED. CONTENTS DENTED AND LEAKING FLUID. DescribePack: DUE TO DAMAGE TO CONTENTS, LEAKAGE CAME FROM CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: LIQUID IN TRAILER WAS CLEANED UP WITH AMPHOMAG AND ABSORBENT PADS. DAMAGED HAZMAT PLACED IN HAZBAG AND SALVAGE BIN AND TAKEN TO HAZMAT PROCESSING AREA.

item.description:

item.title: Report X-2023070025
item.description:
Report X-2023070025

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was found leaking at the OAKH facility. The fiberboard box contained four plastic jugs separated by a fiberboard divider. One of the jugs split at the seam of the jug causing it to release it's contents. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023070003
item.description:
Report X-2023070003

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-17
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 17th, an odor was discovered in a package. Further investigation revealed that the inner receptacle contained UN1293 Paint, 3, PGIII. The lid of the paint can had popped open causing some spillage. The package was cleaned and placed into a salvage drum. The shipper has been contacted for an amended shipper declaration.
